name: Hotel Kea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Kea is pretty high quality compared to many of the hotels in Icelend which tend to be more of a motel quality.
reviews.title: Good hotel in a lovely town

likes.liked: — Location in the heart of the city near to the church
likes.disliked: — The cost of the food was prohibitive.

reviews.text: If you are visiting Iceland I would definitely recommend a stop in Akureyri. It is one of the more interesting towns and has a stunning church and nice botanical gardens and a milder climate than much of the rest of the island. There are a number of good quality restaurants. It is also a good location from which to explore the surrounding area including Lake Myvatn.
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay in Akureyri because we saw the northen nights on 2 of the 3 nights we stayed there, which was really special. Our room at the Hotel Kea had a balcony from which we could watch the sky to look out for this phemonmenon.
reviews.title: Excellent - recommended

likes.liked: — Central location and good all round
likes.disliked: — car parking can be an issue - but with a short walk all OK

reviews.text: The hotel itself is nice, a bit busier than some of the others we stayed in because Akureyri is one of the larger towns. The breakfast wasn't particularly special and the restaurant was too expensive to eat at. The deor is a little old and in need of update. Unlike most hotels in Iceland there wasn't much car parking available.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

reviews.text: A very pleasant hotel in a top-class location in a lovely town. The service was efficient and friendly and the breakfast was good. Rooms were comfortable if a bit small. There is free internet service in the lobby – a big plus if you need to check your emails! As others have noted, there is very little parking in front of the hotel but a big car park about 50-100 yds away.
reviews.title: this hotel has gotten better!

likes.liked: — feather duvets, short walk to work
likes.disliked: — church staircase very close to window outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Functional hotel with no character, rooms incredibly hot and stuffy making it difficult to sleep. The hotel bar was strangely cosy though. We didn't have dinner at the hotel as there were so many good restaurants in Akureyri (the Japanese just up the road is excellent).
reviews.title: OK, nothing special.

reviews.text: The staff were indifferent and unhelpful, for example, we asked were we could park our car and got a very vague answer, so had to figure it out for ourselves.
reviews.title: Great skiing offer
Overpriced but ok.
reviews.text: All in all, adequate but forgettable, I thing there is probably better in Akureyri for the money..

Good hotel and great service! We had a great skiing offer, 3 night, 3 breakfasts and two , 3 courses, dinners. at 19,900 isl. kr. The hotel is in a great locations in the down town area. Just beside Akureyri´s Church. Akureyri´s skiing area is just about 10-15 min drive away from the Hotel Kea.
reviews.title: Unexpected Northern Delight

reviews.title: Great location in Akureyi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We passed there three nights in April 2004. The room was very tiny and the staff was not friendly. The buffet breakfast was good but crowded. The only advantage of the Kea is the central location with the huge Akureyri Church behind and the main street at 50 m.
reviews.title: Too expansive for the standing

reviews.text: Try to find a less expansive hotel, during april 2004 we payed 450 € for three nights!!
reviews.title: Not recommended
Great place and location.
reviews.text: We had booked for Hotel Harpa and was "upgraded" to Hotel Kea (same owners). There was very little hotel parking (3 spots). The only other option was to pay for parking. We got lucky and got one of the three spots. The staff was not very friendly nor helpful. There was a charge for internet access (only place we stayed that did). There was a lot of noise between rooms (could hear the guy next door snoring and coughing all night). The room did not seem very clean. There was a large puddle outside the shower when we checked it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the location was near shops and restaurants. Breakfast was included in the room charge.
reviews.title: Yes, definitely avoid the Kea!

reviews.text: Before I went, I was a bit concerned having read the previous reviews about this hotel. However, I must say that we had great rooms (for our party of 3). Perhaps they have refurbished in the last few months, because all the furniture and decor was almost new. The rooms were extremely comfortable and pleasant. We had great views of the Fjord too. And of course, it is centrally located. Parking is tight, I must admit, and we were lucky to get a spot to the side of the hotel by the main entrance. However they tell us there is free parking space across the road (by the Information Office) and a Parking lot nearby.
reviews.title: Perfect for exploring Northern Iceland

description: Mid 20th-century hotel located in the heart of Akureyri, the gateway to the rich natural splendor of northeast Iceland.
